column4: Gave me the message below when I tried clicking on partitions and the cd-rom drive:
Error
Could not open location 'file:///media/
No application is registered as handling this file
Thanks.
sorry
is there anything in the cd drive?
yes. the files and the cd drive gets mounted even it give the error message posted.
try with something you know that works in the cd drive. Im not certain but it appears it isnt actually mounted
yes. the drive gets mounted anyway, but it does not launch nautilus. I still have to click on it using Places on Computer
there is the live CD (10.04lts) on it right now.
are you saying you are running from the live cd or that it is just in the drive?
I'm not running from it.
I'd expect to see something like /media/disk or /media/cdrom or /media/<cd title> when it was mounted. Is there anything in your /media directory?
I sent my reply via past.ubuntu.com.
you'll have to paste the link
sorry guys... http://paste.ubuntu.com/657797/
Is it trying to open the right thing when you click it in Places menu?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/657801/
Could not open location 'file:///media/(drive or cd-rom)

Im not sure how that menu is generated, I think its probably done dynamically. The only reason I can really think of for the error is that it is trying to open something which isn't there or an incorrect path to it. If that is OK tho then I would keep asking every so often and eventually somebody with moar brainz will come along :)
I tried the ubuntu forums, with no luck either. Thanks!
